alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin; Ripley; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:40AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN FRANKLIN, WESTERN WAYNE, NORTHERN RIPLEY AND FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 AM EDT... At 339 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near New Castle to near Greensburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Connersville, Batesville, Cambridge City, Hagerstown, Dublin, Oldenburg, Glenwood, Lake Santee, Franklin, Waterloo, Blooming Grove, Columbia, Sunman, Metamora, Bunker Hill, Laurel, Greens Fork, East Germantown, Napoleon and Economy. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 144. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
